Pride-90.op_claim: I believe gay pride parades are a gross and inappropriate festivity that damages the LGBT community. CMV
Pride-90.op_premise: I support LGBT rights. I want my children to support the LGBT community too, but I can't take them to a gay pride parade. There is a lot of inappropriate imagery and goings on that I don't want my children exposed to.", 'The parades also reinforce the stereotype that homosexuals are out-of-control nymphomaniacs. This fear fuels the conservative agenda:', '"If you want to see what the gay community is all about, go watch their pride parade. Do you want your children to accept that as a normal predisposition in life?"', 'I feel like the gay community should have a positive outreach celebration to show everyone how "normal" the average gay person is.', "I've heard the argument that the pride parades exist for homosexuals to just be themselves, but I don't agree with it. To me, that's like having a heterosexual pride festival full of explicit sexual themes.

reply_contents.content: 364 days of the year, gay people work in offices and keep to ourselves and generally are normal everyday people

reply_contents.content: Plenty of us are still in the closet

reply_contents.content: You don't think we should get one day to be as flamboyant as we so desire

reply_contents.content: And there is a part that I am sorry, but you will never understand as a heterosexual

reply_contents.content: I remember going to my very first Pride in San Francisco
elo_info: I remember going to my very first Pride in San Francisco

reply_contents.content: I watched the parade, and walked around looking at rainbows, and for the very first time in my life, felt like it was okay to be who I was
elo_info: I watched the parade, and walked around looking at rainbows, and for the very first time in my life, felt like it was okay to be who I was

reply_contents.content: For just one day, in this one place, if I hit on a woman, I knew she wouldn't be offended
elo_info: For just one day, in this one place, if I hit on a woman, I knew she wouldn't be offended

reply_contents.content: She might not be interested - she might even be straight - but she wouldn't be offended
elo_info: She might not be interested - she might even be straight - but she wouldn't be offended

reply_contents.content: I could go up to a cute stranger and strike up a conversation and not have to search for subtle hints before I could even start flirting, because even if my attention wasn't reciprocated, it wouldn't be met with disgust or physical violence
elo_info: I could go up to a cute stranger and strike up a conversation and not have to search for subtle hints before I could even start flirting, because even if my attention wasn't reciprocated, it wouldn't be met with disgust or physical violence

reply_contents.content: I didn't realize until that moment how wrong it was the rest of the time that I didn't feel that way
elo_info: I didn't realize until that moment how wrong it was the rest of the time that I didn't feel that way

reply_contents.content: I can't flirt with the cute cashier or the stranger on the bus
elo_info: I can't flirt with the cute cashier or the stranger on the bus

reply_contents.content: Not without doing the mental math on how likely they are to freak out at me
elo_info: Not without doing the mental math on how likely they are to freak out at me

reply_contents.content: But during Pride
elo_info: But during Pride

reply_contents.content: During Pride, it's finally okay

reply_contents.content: It's one day

reply_contents.content: Turn off the TV and stay inside and play board games if you're so worried that your children seeing a few naked guys and a lot of silly costumes is going to scar them forever

reply_contents.content: Even if these events bring negative attention, even if they are "gross" (they aren't), they serve the purpose of forcing society-at-large to recognize that there are in fact large numbers of gay people among them, while working to desensitize them to some of their squeamishness about homosexuality by being blatantly over the top expressing it

reply_contents.content: Seriously, once you (as a hypothetically mild homophobe) see a couple of guys in slave harness dry-humping on a parade float surrounding by glitter-encrusted gladiators shooting whipped-cream at passersby from crotch level, seeing a gay couple quietly holding hands as they walk down the street becomes far less shocking and may even look positively hum-drum to you
